title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhengpeng Zeng. Author, maintainer, contributor. Longfei Mao. Author. Feng Yu. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zeng Z, Mao L, Yu F (2023). MantaID: Machine-Learning Based Tool Automate Identification Biological Database IDs. R package version 1.0.2, https://molaison.github.io/MantaID/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MantaID: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs},   author = {Zhengpeng Zeng and Longfei Mao and Feng Yu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.2},   url = {https://molaison.github.io/MantaID/}, }

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: tutorial introduces MantaID, machine-learning-based tool automate identification biological database IDs. IDs required simple access biological data facilitating cross-referencing databases. However, due lack universal agreement composition database ID, resulting situation biological entity may various IDs. Current ID conversion tools require previous knowledge database belong incapable identifying IDs absence database names. MantaID bridges gap enabling identification IDs, facilitating text-mining scientific documents ID conversion. Additionally, shiny application offered, accessible via MantaID (shinyapps.io) API via MantaIDapi.

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: computational framework approaches MantaID implemented software package handles different steps model development process makes easy create user-defined ID recognition models adjusting parameters.

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: tutorial based R. installed R, find introduction run computer . turning workflow, please install packages running code . Next, load MantaID package. deep-learning achieved MantaID calling tensorflow via keras package, python tensorflow need installed first. install python tensorflow dependencies, please follow instructions provided Tensorflow via TensorFlow installation. Use tensorflow R. Please replace “/path//python.exe” python path.
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager",repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("remotes",repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") library(remotes) library(BiocManager) if (!requireNamespace("biomaRt", quietly = TRUE))     BiocManager::install("biomaRt", version = "3.16") install_bitbucket("Molaison/MantaID") library(MantaID) install.packages("reticulate") library(reticulate) # path_to_python <- use_python(python = "/path/to/python.exe")

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: section illustrates procure data training biomaRt package. give MantaID test drive, use human genome-related datasets train MantaID model. Users can specify another dataset use customized IDs data. First, use mi_get_ID_attr function get attributes dataset associated ID. , attributes screened , retrieve corresponding data data frame two columns, ID class. Sometimes data obtained sources ID mapping table, row corresponding ID entity, column corresponds different database. , training need reorganize table remove invalid values using mi_clean_data function. example: processing IDs needed training. first step split IDs multiple columns character character. IDs filled “*” maximum length IDs guarantee consistent data dimension. Users can also specify pad_len parameter control number features used following training. IDs split several columns single characters, available training. mi_to_numer function specifies levels feature column prefixed “pos” converts factor type. learn R factor, please refer . concern compatibility, feature columns converted integer type can directly used training. Features converted numeric type target column class remains factor type.
code: attributes = mi_get_ID_attr(biomart = "genes", dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl", mirror = "asia") %>% slice(1:10) data_ID = mi_get_ID(attributes,biomart = "genes", dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl", mirror = "asia") data_ID data <- tibble::tibble(     "ensembl_gene_id" = c("ENSG00000001626","ENSG00000002549","ENSG00000002586","ENSG00000002745"),     'ensembl_exon_id' = c("ENSE00002398851","ENSE00002398851","ENSE00002398851","ENSE00002398851"),     'refseq_peptide' = c("NP_001303256","-","NP_001382772","NP_001340728") ) data_ID_clean = mi_clean_data(data,placeholder="-") data_ID_clean pad_len = mi_get_padlen(data_ID) data_splt = mi_split_col(data_ID,cores = NULL,pad_len = pad_len) str(data_splt) data_fct = mi_to_numer(data_splt,levels = c("*", 0:9, letters, LETTERS, "_", ".", "-", " ", "/", "\\", ":"))

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: prevent trained model losing ability distinguish databases small numbers IDs, necessary balance data. one hand, smote method used oversample databases small numbers IDs increase data density, hand, databases large numbers IDs undersampled random sampling reduce number IDs. performing data balancing function mi_balance_data based scutr package, allowing parallel Mac computers. data set produced balancing used test set, ratio proportion original data set divided test set, portion data removed balanced data set, remaining portion used training set. data balancing, number majority minority classes generally balanced.
code: data_blcd = mi_balance_data(data_fct,ratio = 0.3,parallel = F) train = data_blcd[[1]] %>% mutate(across(-class,.fns = ~tidyr::replace_na(.x,0)))%>% dplyr::slice(sample(nrow(data_blcd[[1]]), 10000), preserve = TRUE)  test = data_blcd[[2]] print(train %>% group_by(class) %>% summarize(n = n())) print(data_fct %>% group_by(class) %>% summarize(n = n()))

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: MantaID contains four machine-learning submodels: Classification Regression Tree (CART), Random Forest (RF), eXtreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost), Back Propagation Neural Network (BPNN). first three models, achieve hyperband tuning find best parameter configurations based mlr3hyperband package. understanding hyperband algorithm, please visit . iteration, complete run sequential halving executed. , evaluating configuration subset size, fraction 1/eta ‘advances’ next round. paramter eta default set 3. mi_tune_* function, except performing hyperband tuning, stage plots also drawn manifest “competition” different parameter configurations.
code: #Decision Tree inst_rp <- mi_tune_rp(train, eta = 3, resampling = rsmp("bootstrap", ratio = 0.8, repeats = 3)) #Random Forest inst_rg <- mi_tune_rg(train, eta = 3, resampling = rsmp("bootstrap", ratio = 0.8, repeats = 3)) #Xgboost inst_xgb <- mi_tune_xgb(train, eta = 3, resampling = rsmp("bootstrap", ratio = 0.8, repeats = 3))  inst_rp[[2]] inst_rg[[2]] inst_xgb[[2]]

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: tuning, optimal parameter configuration calculated can used following training passing tuner instances mi_train_* function.
code: #Decision Tree result_rp <- mi_train_rp(train, test, measure = msr("classif.acc"), instance = inst_rp[[1]]) #Random Forest result_rg <- mi_train_rg(train, test, measure = msr("classif.acc"), instance = inst_rg[[1]]) #Xgboost result_xgb <- mi_train_xgb(train, test, measure = msr("classif.acc"), instance = inst_xgb[[1]])  #BPNN result_BP <- mi_train_BP(train, test, path2save = NULL, batch_size = 128, epochs = 64, validation_split = 0.3)

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs
text: evaluate performance models, confusion matrices test set calculated visualized heatmap. row matrix represents instances actual class column represents instances predicted class, vice versa. heatmaps, value squares depicts number samples whose actual classes Reference, predicted Prediction. clarity, zero values omitted. MantaID implements submodel unification based new method. cases majority class prediction results, MantaID adopts voting method directly, cases scattered opinions, MantaID calculates score results model find optimal result. integrated column final result MantaID determined. prove effectiveness unification method, can compare balance accuracy classes test set. integrated model inherits individual models’ strengths well, scoring high almost classes compared sub-models.
code: matri_rp <- mi_get_confusion(result_rp) matri_rg <- mi_get_confusion(result_rg) matri_xgb <- mi_get_confusion(result_xgb) matri_BP <- mi_get_confusion(result_BP,ifnet = T)  mi_plot_heatmap(matri_rp, name="rp",filepath = "Graph/") mi_plot_heatmap(matri_rg, name="rg",filepath = "Graph/") mi_plot_heatmap(matri_xgb, name="xgb",filepath = "Graph/") mi_plot_heatmap(matri_BP, name="BP",filepath = "Graph/") data("mi_data_rawID") data = mi_data_rawID final_result = mi_unify_mod(data, "ID",result_rg,result_rp,result_xgb,result_BP,c_value = 0.75, pad_len = pad_len) final_result balance_accuracy = map_dfc(as.list(final_result),function(x){     confusion = confusionMatrix(data = x,reference = data$class)$byClass %>% as.data.frame()     return(confusion%>% select(`Balanced Accuracy`)) }) %>% set_names(names(final_result)) balance_accuracy

title: A Machine-Learning Based Tool to Automate the Identification of Biological Database IDs

text: tutorial introduces MantaID, machine-learning-based tool automate identification biological database IDs. IDs required simple access biological data facilitating cross-referencing databases. However, due lack universal agreement composition database ID, resulting situation biological entity may various IDs. Current ID conversion tools require previous knowledge database belong incapable identifying IDs absence database names. MantaID bridges gap enabling identification IDs, facilitating text-mining scientific documents ID conversion. Additionally, shiny application offered, accessible via MantaID (shinyapps.io) API via MantaIDapi.

Next, load MantaID package. deep-learning achieved MantaID calling tensorflow via keras package, python tensorflow need installed first. install python tensorflow dependencies, please follow instructions provided Tensorflow via TensorFlow installation. Use tensorflow R. Please replace “/path//python.exe” python path.
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager",repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("remotes",repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") library(remotes) library(BiocManager) if (!requireNamespace("biomaRt", quietly = TRUE))     BiocManager::install("biomaRt", version = "3.16") install_bitbucket("Molaison/MantaID") library(MantaID) install.packages("reticulate") library(reticulate) # path_to_python <- use_python(python = "/path/to/python.exe")

title: NA
text: section illustrates procure data training biomaRt package. give MantaID test drive, use human genome-related datasets train MantaID model. Users can specify another dataset use customized IDs data. First, use mi_get_ID_attr function get attributes dataset associated ID. , attributes screened , retrieve corresponding data data frame two columns, ID class. Sometimes data obtained sources ID mapping table, row corresponding ID entity, column corresponds different database. , training need reorganize table remove invalid values using mi_clean_data function. example: processing IDs needed training. first step split IDs multiple columns character character. IDs filled “*” maximum length IDs guarantee consistent data dimension. Users can also specify pad_len parameter control number features used following training. IDs split several columns single characters, available training. mi_to_numer function specifies levels feature column prefixed “pos” converts factor type. learn R factor, please refer . concern compatibility, feature columns converted integer type can directly used training. Features converted numeric type target column class remains factor type.
code: attributes = mi_get_ID_attr(biomart = "genes", dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl", mirror = "asia") %>% slice(1:10) data_ID = mi_get_ID(attributes,biomart = "genes", dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl", mirror = "asia") data_ID data <- tibble::tibble(     "ensembl_gene_id" = c("ENSG00000001626","ENSG00000002549","ENSG00000002586","ENSG00000002745"),     'ensembl_exon_id' = c("ENSE00002398851","ENSE00002398851","ENSE00002398851","ENSE00002398851"),     'refseq_peptide' = c("NP_001303256","-","NP_001382772","NP_001340728") ) data_ID_clean = mi_clean_data(data,placeholder="-") data_ID_clean pad_len = mi_get_padlen(data_ID) data_splt = mi_split_col(data_ID,cores = NULL,pad_len = pad_len) str(data_splt) data_fct = mi_to_numer(data_splt,levels = c("*", 0:9, letters, LETTERS, "_", ".", "-", " ", "/", "\\", ":"))

title: NA
text: prevent trained model losing ability distinguish databases small numbers IDs, necessary balance data. one hand, smote method used oversample databases small numbers IDs increase data density, hand, databases large numbers IDs undersampled random sampling reduce number IDs. performing data balancing function mi_balance_data based scutr package, allowing parallel Mac computers. data set produced balancing used test set, ratio proportion original data set divided test set, portion data removed balanced data set, remaining portion used training set. data balancing, number majority minority classes generally balanced.
code: data_blcd = mi_balance_data(data_fct,ratio = 0.3,parallel = F) train = data_blcd[[1]] %>% mutate(across(-class,.fns = ~tidyr::replace_na(.x,0)))%>% dplyr::slice(sample(nrow(data_blcd[[1]]), 10000), preserve = TRUE)  test = data_blcd[[2]] print(train %>% group_by(class) %>% summarize(n = n())) print(data_fct %>% group_by(class) %>% summarize(n = n()))

title: NA
text: MantaID contains four machine-learning submodels: Classification Regression Tree (CART), Random Forest (RF), eXtreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost), Back Propagation Neural Network (BPNN). first three models, achieve hyperband tuning find best parameter configurations based mlr3hyperband package. understanding hyperband algorithm, please visit . iteration, complete run sequential halving executed. , evaluating configuration subset size, fraction 1/eta ‘advances’ next round. paramter eta default set 3. mi_tune_* function, except performing hyperband tuning, stage plots also drawn manifest “competition” different parameter configurations.
code: #Decision Tree inst_rp <- mi_tune_rp(train, eta = 3, resampling = rsmp("bootstrap", ratio = 0.8, repeats = 3)) #Random Forest inst_rg <- mi_tune_rg(train, eta = 3, resampling = rsmp("bootstrap", ratio = 0.8, repeats = 3)) #Xgboost inst_xgb <- mi_tune_xgb(train, eta = 3, resampling = rsmp("bootstrap", ratio = 0.8, repeats = 3))  inst_rp[[2]] inst_rg[[2]] inst_xgb[[2]]

title: NA
text: tuning, optimal parameter configuration calculated can used following training passing tuner instances mi_train_* function.
code: #Decision Tree result_rp <- mi_train_rp(train, test, measure = msr("classif.acc"), instance = inst_rp[[1]]) #Random Forest result_rg <- mi_train_rg(train, test, measure = msr("classif.acc"), instance = inst_rg[[1]]) #Xgboost result_xgb <- mi_train_xgb(train, test, measure = msr("classif.acc"), instance = inst_xgb[[1]])  #BPNN result_BP <- mi_train_BP(train, test, path2save = NULL, batch_size = 128, epochs = 64, validation_split = 0.3)

title: NA
text: evaluate performance models, confusion matrices test set calculated visualized heatmap. row matrix represents instances actual class column represents instances predicted class, vice versa. heatmaps, value squares depicts number samples whose actual classes Reference, predicted Prediction. clarity, zero values omitted. MantaID implements submodel unification based new method. cases majority class prediction results, MantaID adopts voting method directly, cases scattered opinions, MantaID calculates score results model find optimal result. integrated column final result MantaID determined. prove effectiveness unification method, can compare balance accuracy classes test set. integrated model inherits individual models’ strengths well, scoring high almost classes compared sub-models.
code: matri_rp <- mi_get_confusion(result_rp) matri_rg <- mi_get_confusion(result_rg) matri_xgb <- mi_get_confusion(result_xgb) matri_BP <- mi_get_confusion(result_BP,ifnet = T)  mi_plot_heatmap(matri_rp, name="rp",filepath = "Graph/") mi_plot_heatmap(matri_rg, name="rg",filepath = "Graph/") mi_plot_heatmap(matri_xgb, name="xgb",filepath = "Graph/") mi_plot_heatmap(matri_BP, name="BP",filepath = "Graph/") data("mi_data_rawID") data = mi_data_rawID final_result = mi_unify_mod(data, "ID",result_rg,result_rp,result_xgb,result_BP,c_value = 0.75, pad_len = pad_len) final_result balance_accuracy = map_dfc(as.list(final_result),function(x){     confusion = confusionMatrix(data = x,reference = data$class)$byClass %>% as.data.frame()     return(confusion%>% select(`Balanced Accuracy`)) }) %>% set_names(names(final_result)) balance_accuracy
